Subject: Literature
Description: VCE Literature focuses on the meanings derived from texts, the relationships between texts, the contexts in which texts are produced, and how readers' experiences shape their responses to texts.

Subject: Literature
Description: In VCE Literature students develop and refine four key abilities through their engagement with texts. These are:

Subject: Literature
Description: An ability to offer an interpretation of a whole text (or a collection of texts)

Subject: Literature
Description: An ability to demonstrate a close analysis of passages or extracts from a text, in consideration of the whole text

Subject: Literature
Description: An ability to understand and explore multiple interpretations of a text

Subject: Literature
Description: An ability to respond creatively to a text.

Subject: Literature
Description: Students are provided with opportunities to read deeply, widely and critically; to appreciate the aesthetic qualities of texts; and to write creatively and analytically.

Subject: Literature
Description: VCE Literature enables students to examine the historical, social and cultural contexts within which both readers and texts are situated. Accordingly, the texts selected for study should be drawn from a wide range of eras, a variety of forms and diverse social and cultural contexts.

Subject: Literature
Description: The study of VCE Literature fosters students' enjoyment and appreciation of the artistic and aesthetic merits of stories and storytelling, and enables students to participate more fully in the cultural conversations that take place around them. By reading and exploring a diverse range of established and emerging literary works, students become increasingly empowered to discuss texts. As both readers and writers, students extend their creativity and high-order thinking to express and develop their critical and creative voices.

Subject: Literature
Description: Throughout this study, students deepen their awareness of the historical, social and cultural influences that shape texts and their understanding of themselves as readers. Students expand their frameworks for exploring literature by considering literary forms and features, engaging with language, and refining their insight into authorial choices. Students immerse themselves in challenging fiction and non-fiction texts, discovering and experimenting with a variety of interpretations in order to develop their own responses.

Subject: Literature
Description: This study enables students to:

Subject: Literature
Description: Enjoy reading a range of challenging literary texts

Subject: Literature
Description: Approach unfamiliar texts and negotiate diverse literary territories with confidence

Subject: Literature
Description: Explore the ways in which authors craft their writing

Subject: Literature
Description: Recognise there are many possible ways of interpreting literary texts

Subject: Literature
Description: Develop their own responses to texts, recognising the impact of form, features and language in the creation of meaning

Subject: Literature
Description: Write creatively and critically, and develop their individual voice

Subject: Literature
Description: Consider the views of others, including when developing interpretations

Subject: Literature
Description: Express their ideas, through all language modes, with insight and flair.

Subject: Literature
Description: The study is made up of four units. Each unit deals with specific content contained in areas of study and is designed to enable students to achieve a set of outcomes for that unit. Each outcome is described in terms of key knowledge and key skills.

Subject: Literature
Description: Units 1 and 2

Subject: Literature
Description: Procedures for the assessment of levels of achievement in Units 1 and 2 are a matter for school decision. Assessment of levels of achievement for these units will not be reported to the VCAA. Schools may choose to report levels of achievement using grades, descriptive statements or other indicators.

Subject: Literature
Description: Units 3 and 4

Subject: Literature
Description: The VCAA specifies the assessment procedures for students undertaking scored assessment in Units 3 and 4. Designated assessment tasks are provided in the details for each unit in VCE study designs.

Subject: Literature
Description: The student's level of achievement in Units 3 and 4 will be determined by School-assessed Coursework (SAC) as specified in the VCE study design, and external assessment.

Subject: Literature
Description:
The VCAA will report the student's level of achievement on each assessment component as a grade from
A+ to E or UG (ungraded). To receive a study score the student must achieve two or more graded assessments in the study and receive an S for both Units 3 and 4. The study score is reported on a scale of 0-50; it is a measure of how well the student performed in relation to all others who took the study. Teachers should refer to the current VCE Administrative Handbook for details on graded assessment and calculation of the study score.

Subject: Literature
Description: Percentage contributions to the study score in VCE Literature are as follows:

Subject: Literature
Description: Unit 3 School-assessed Coursework/Units 3 and 4 School-assessed Coursework: 25 per cent

Subject: Literature
Description: Unit 4 School-assessed Coursework/Units 3 and 4 School-assessed Coursework: 25 per cent

Subject: Literature
Description: End-of-year examination: 50 per cent.

Subject: Literature
Description: Details of the assessment program are described in the sections on Units 3 and 4 in this study design.
